Authors: Robert W. Lichtwardt, Alexandra M. Gottlieb
Title:
Molecular variation within and between species of Harpellales
(Trichomycetes).
Keywords:
18S rDNA; ITS; phylogeny; RFLP; Smittium; Trichomycetes;
Zygomycota
Abstract:
Intra- and interspecific variation of the nuclear
ribosomal internal transcribed spacers (ITS) of 77 Smittium isolates and
related genera was studied using RFLPs. Due to the sequence and length
variation encountered, the ITS is unsuitable for comparison at the
species level within Smittium, as presently delimited. Intra- and
interspecific variation of 18S rDNA was also analyzed. Cladistic
analysis of 32 new 18S rDNA sequences resolved at least five lineages
and suggests that Smittium is non-monophyletic. In addition, 17 18S rDNA
sequences from 5 orders of Zygomycota were included to assess phyletic
relationships with the Trichomycetes. The kickxellid origin of
Trichomycetes was not strongly supported. Morphological features of
trichomycete taxa included in this study are discussed.
